description_en:
Reiner Schöne (born 19 January 1942) is a German actor, known for television roles as Dukhat in the series Babylon 5, Esoqq in the Star Trek: The Next Generation episode "Allegiance", and Kolitar in the series Sliders, as well as film roles that include Karl Freytag in the Clint Eastwood thriller The Eiger Sanction, Shinnok in Mortal Kombat Annihilation, and Green Goblin and Optimus Prime in the German dubs of the live-action Spider-Man and Transformers film series respectively.

Ina and Reiner were in a relationship from 1968 till 1975

Ursula Andress (born 19 March 1936)[1] is a Swiss actress and former model who has appeared in American, British, and Italian films. Her breakthrough role was as Bond girl Honey Ryder in the first James Bond film, Dr. No (1962).

Ina and Ursula were close friends since the 1950's
Cary Grant (born Archibald Alec Leach; 18 January 1904 – 29 November 1986) was an English-American actor

photos.description_en: Cary Grant riding out with Ina

description_en:
Werner Wunderlich (1930–1991) was a prominent German couturier based in Munich, particularly influential between the 1950s and the 1980s. He was often described by the press of his time as Munich’s "youngest and strangest" or most "extravagant" designer, known for blending high fashion with traditional Bavarian elements and avant-garde concepts.

He was also the godfather of Ina's son Michael

Nancy Kwan Ka-shen (Chinese: 關家蒨; born May 19, 1939) is a Chinese-American actress whose career benefited from Hollywood's casting of more Asian roles in the 1960s, especially in comedies. She was considered an Eastern sex symbol in the 1960s.

photos.description_en: at her wedding with her brother
at her wedding with her husband Peter Pock

description_en: Elvis Aaron Presley (January 8, 1935 – August 16, 1977) was an American singer and actor. Referred to as the "King of Rock and Roll", he is widely regarded as one of the most culturally significant figures of the 20th century.

photos.description_en: Ina presenting Elvis with a medal

description_en: Muhammad Ali (born Cassius Marcellus Clay Jr.; January 17, 1942 – June 3, 2016) was an American professional boxer and activist.

description_de: Klaus Löwitsch (* 8. April 1936 in Berlin; † 3. Dezember 2002 in München) war ein österreichisch-deutscher Schauspieler. Er galt als bedeutender Charakterdarsteller in Film, Fernsehen und auf der Theaterbühne

description_en: Kirk Douglas (born Issur Danielovitch; December 9, 1916 – February 5, 2020) was an American actor and filmmaker.

Rosalie Helga Lina Zech (7 July 1940 – 31 August 2011),[1] known as Rosel Zech, was a German theater and film actress, she is most well known for her works associated with the "Autorenkino" (New German Cinema) movement, which began in the 1970s.

photos.description_en: Rosel Zech in the 1982 "Veronica Voss", 1982 directed by Rainer Werner Fassbinder
Rosel Zech in the 1982 "Veronica Voss", 1982 directed by Rainer Werner Fassbinder
Rosel Zech in the 1982 "Veronica Voss", 1982 directed by Rainer Werner Fassbinder

description_en: John Gavin (born Juan Vincent Apablasa; April 8, 1931 – February 9, 2018) was an American actor and diplomat who was the president of the Screen Actors Guild (1971–1973), and the United States Ambassador to Mexico (1981–1986).
